Text:
The Shadow Garden members spend their days doing
intense training and difficult missions. And so, each is
spending their first day off duty in a while just as they
please. Beta, of course, is one of them.

Heehee. Lady Alpha's given me some pocket money.
Now, what should I spend it on?

To start off, I'll go pick myself out a new book...
Oh, but if I find myself in the book store, then I'm
sure to blow my budget.

Though I should limit myself to one, I always end up
wanting the entire shelf.
Not something I can afford on my allowance. At all.

Ooh...how about that new desserts place I heard
about? It's the perfect chanceâ€”ah...

But in that case, rather than eat at the shop it'd be
better if I buy something for Master Shadow and
Lady Alpha.

After all, I'm by myself today, and good food always
tastes best when you've got company.

*sigh* Lots of things catch my attention when I'm
walking down the street like this. But the fear of
overspending always makes it harder to choose...
I wonder what the others do with their allowance.

I've never asked, but I bet they're doing pretty much
the same thing as meâ€”wondering what to spend it on.

Hm...but I seem to remember Epsilon saying something
about going shopping for clothes. She does love her
fashion, so I guess she'll come home with something
new.
Beta's eyes fall upon her own outfit.
No, I don't need new clothes at the moment.

Epsilon always tells me that I'm unadventurous,
sticking just to safe colors and whatnot.

Hmmm... But while these clothes are certainly a bit
plain compared to what Epsilon always wears,

they're pretty cute, right? Even if I don't care to
try new things...

Looking at her reflection in the store windows, Beta
continues musing out loud...
The important thing is that they suit me. After all...

This look of mineâ€”bowtie coupled with glassesâ€”gives
off precisely the impression I want, of a quiet, clever
young lady.

But that's not all. The feeling of the material on
my skin, the neat stitching, and the colors. I fell
in love with every single detail.
Right, new clothes can wait.

Heheh... Come to think of it, thinking about how I
should spend my allowance is pretty fun too.

Of course, it's nice to to buy new things, but surely
I'm not the only one who feels this way?

Window-shopping, strolling into this shop or that
to have a look, is just the bestâ€”
And with her eyes anywhere but in front of her...
I-I'm sorry! I wasn't paying attention to where...

The person she'd bumped intoâ€”the contents of
their bag are now strewn all over the street...
O-Oh my goodness! I'm so sorry!

Caught off guard by her own carelessness, Beta
can only bow her head over and over in apology.

No no, it's okay. Luckily, nothing is broken, so
please don't worry about it. More importantly,
are you alright?

It is a gentle voice. Beta raises her head and sees a
young woman picking up the things that have
been scattered on the ground.
O-Oh! Please let me help!
Words that aren't an apology finally come to her lips.

(What was I thinking! In this kind of situation, the
first thing to do is always to pick up whatever was
dropped!)
Oh, it's completely fine.

No, really! I wasn't watching where I was going,
so this is all my fault!
Oh no. They've got dirt on them!

Hehehe. It really is fine, so please calm down.
It's just a bit of dust, so I can brush it right off.
See?

Oh, thank goodness! Hm...this notebook. Oh wow!
Are these your illustrations? They're amazing!

Bright, colorful images dance upon the pages of the
notebook that she'd picked up.

Oh, these? I'm just an amateur, so it's a little
embarrassing that you've seen my clumsy work.

Ack...I'm sorry. But "clumsy" isn't how I'd describe
themâ€”more like joyful and fun!

Well, don't you think happy times pass by in a flash?
Especially compared to times that are difficult or
rough.
That's true...

That's why I've been keeping a picture diary. As long
as you record those happy times, you can always
relive them, right?

I suppose you could say it's like using the good times
to paint over the bad ones.

I see... And it's even more effective because you have
them in pictures rather than in words.
Exactly!

(A way to relive the good times... I hadn't thought
of that. Perhaps I should try it out myself.)

Back already, Beta? It's fine to stay out a bit later,
you know.

Oh? If you're clutching it so tightly, you must have
bought something nice with your allowance.
It is! Here's what I bought for myself.
A...notebook? Is that really enough?

Heheh. Well, I went around to all the stationery
shops I could find, and finally found one that
I fell in love with at first sight!

But the best part about today is the wonderful
opportunity that I came across. So this really is
all I could ask for!

Is that...so? Well, I am glad that you found
something you really wanted.

A beaming smile on her face, Beta dashes off to her
room, eager to get started.

Let's see...the favorite pen that I always use when
writing...the new colored pencils that I bought...
Next I open up this new notebook...
Alright! I'm ready to start!

(I'll fill the pages of this brand new notebook with
all the memorable, amazing, and fun things that
I experience.)

(And not just in writing, but also in pictures, just
like that young lady I met today. This way, the
bad times will no longer have me standing still,
trapped in the same place.)

And of course, I should begin with the wonderful
encounter I had today.

Ah...come to think of it, the first page should really
be for the most important day of my life. The day
that Master Shadow saved me...
